cypher_method

Class ChuckNorris

  • java.lang.Object
    • cypher_abstract.CypherAbstract
      • cypher_method.ChuckNorris
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CypherInterface

    public class ChuckNorris
extends CypherAbstract
    Transform a text in binary and then transform the binary in a sequence of 0. This sequence consists of several consecutive packets of 0. In each consecutive packet, the first one is 0 or 00. If 0, then the second packet will contain 1, else it will contain 0. Example : 01001110000 = 0+1+00+111+0000 = 00 0, 0 0, 00 00, 0 000, 00 0000. This encoding method is symmetric.
    Author:
    JHER

    • Method Detail

      • cryptText

        public java.lang.String cryptText(java.lang.String clearText)
        Encode all the chars in binary strings with 7 digits Join them in one long string. Split it in packets of 0 and 1. If packet contains 0, encode it with 00. If packet contains 1, encode it with 0. Turn all 1 in 0. Return all

      • uncryptText

        public java.lang.String uncryptText(java.lang.String cypherText)
        If packet start with 00, do nothing. If packet start with 0, turn all 0 in the next packet in 1. Join all the seconds packets to create a long binaryString of 7 digits. Split this string in packet of 7 digits. Decode all the 7 digits packets in character. Return all

      • characterToBinary

        Encode a character in a 7 digits length binary Example : 101 = 0000101

        Returns:

        private static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> splitIntoPacket(java.lang.String binaryMessage)
